task.title: Setting up documentation environment
task.shortdesc: To write documentation for the project, you need to have the necessary tools installed on your computer.

context.p:
To get up and running, this task guides you through
Cloning the GitHub project
Installing NodeJS (necessary for building the documentation)
Installing project dependencies

step.cmd: Install NodeJS (which includes the npm command) on your computer
step.tutorialinfo: On Windows, download the installer and run it
On macOS, download the installer and run it
step.stepresult: When you run npm -v in your command line, the output should be a version number of the installed version.

step.cmd: Run git clone git@github.com:TelestionGroup/telestion-docs.git in your command line
step.stepresult: The directory telestion-docs, containing the repository's contents, gets created on your system
step.steptroubleshooting: If the command fails with the message that no valid credentials were supplied, make sure you have your SSH key setup in your GitHub Account.

step.cmd: Run cd telestion-docs to enter the documentation directory
Run npm ci to install the project's dependencies

taskbody.result: All necessary dependencies are installed and your work environment is ready to start documenting the project.
